title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 82.5 - Prohibited acts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 82.5 - Prohibited acts

State Regulations

The following acts are prohibited: (a) Building or maintaining a fire, except a
fire for cooking by camp stove or within other suitable container and confined
to a designated site on the area. No fire shall be lighted until all
inflammable material surrounding it has been removed to the extent necessary to
prevent its spread, and no fire shall be left unattended. (b) Removing, cutting or willfully damaging
or destroying living vegetation of any kind, except pursuant to written
permission of the regional supervisor of the Department of Environmental

Conservation having jurisdiction or his agent or the cooperator. (c) Target or indiscriminate
shooting. (d) Injuring, defacing, disturbing or befouling any part of an area or any building, sign, equipment or
other propety found thereon. (e) Discarding or depositing any trash, waste or litter on lands or waters, except
in waste receptacles when provided for such purpose. (f) The use of snowmobiles, trail bikes or
any other motorized vehicle without written permission of the landowner or
lessee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
82.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
